eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* 30 years or older
* Serum alkaline phosphatase (SAP) 2 times upper limit normal (ULN)
* Confirmed diagnosis of Paget's disease of the bone (by x-ray, magnetic resonance imaging, computerized tomography, radioisotope imaging, etc.).
* 90 days washout calcitonin
* 180 day washout bisphosphonate

Exclusion Criteria:

* Allergic reaction to bisphosphonates
* History of upper gastrointestinal disorders
* History of iritis, uveitis
* Calculated creatinine clearance \< 30 ml/min at baseline
* Evidence of vitamin D deficiency

Other protocol-defined inclusion/exclusion criteria applied.

outcomeMeasures.title: Number of Patients Who Achieve Therapeutic Response at 6 Months.
outcomeMeasures.description: Therapeutic response is defined as a reduction of at least 75% from baseline (Visit 1) in total serum alkaline phosphatase excess (difference between measured level and midpoint to the normal range) or normalization of serum alkaline phosphatase at the end of six months.

outcomeMeasures.title: Relative Change in Serum Alkaline Phosphatase (SAP) in Units Per Liter (U/L) at Day 28
outcomeMeasures.description: The percent change in serum alkaline phosphatase from baseline to day 28 was measured.

outcomeMeasures.title: Relative Change in Serum C-telopeptide (CTx) in ng/mL at Day 10
outcomeMeasures.description: The percent change in serum C-telopeptide from baseline to day 10 was measured.

outcomeMeasures.title: Relative Change in Urine Alpha C-telopeptide (Î±-CTx) in ug/mmol at Day 10
outcomeMeasures.description: The percent change in urine alpha C-telopeptide from baseline to day 10 was measured.

outcomeMeasures.title: Time to First Therapeutic Response
outcomeMeasures.description: A therapeutic response was defined as a reduction of at least 75% from baseline (Visit 1) in serum alkaline phosphatase excess (difference between measured level and midpoint to the normal range) or normalization of serum alkaline phosphatase.

outcomeMeasures.title: Number of Patients Who Achieved Serum Alkaline Phosphatase Normalization at Day 28 Relative to Baseline
outcomeMeasures.description: Normalization of serum alkaline phosphatase occurred if the serum alkaline phosphatase measurement fell within the normal range.

outcomeMeasures.title: Change in Pain Severity Score
outcomeMeasures.description: Change in pain severity score from Brief Pain Inventory-Short Form (BPI-SF). This scale values are 0 to 10, a lower score means little to no pain while a higher score means greater pain.

outcomeMeasures.title: Change in Pain Interference Score
outcomeMeasures.description: Change in pain interference score from Brief Pain Inventory-Short Form (BPI-SF). This scale values are 0 to 10, a lower score means little to no pain while a higher score means greater pain.

outcomeMeasures.title: Number of Participants With a Loss of Therapeutic Response During the Extended Observation Period
outcomeMeasures.description: Extended observation period. A therapeutic response is defined as a reduction of at least 75% from baseline in serum alkaline phosphatase excess or normalization of serum alkaline phosphatase.

outcomeMeasures.title: Number of Participants With a Partial Disease Relapse During the Extended Observation Period
outcomeMeasures.description: Extended observation period. A partial disease relapse was defined as an increase in serum alkaline phosphatase \>= 50% from the serum alkaline phosphatase measurement at month 6 and at least 1.25 times the upper normal limit.

outcomeMeasures.title: Number of Participants With a Disease Relapse During the Extended Observation Period
outcomeMeasures.description: Extended observation period. A disease relapse was defined as the occurrence of a serum alkaline phosphatase level that was \>= 80% of baseline serum alkaline phosphatase value.
